sen.j: ただ、淳和院への別当設置と奨学院そのものの設置はともに元慶5年（881年）のことであり、当時の嵯峨源氏及び源氏全体の筆頭公卿であった源融またはその子の源昇が両院別当と源氏長者を兼ねた最初の人物であったと推定されている。
sen.e: However, judging from the fact that the post of chief priest of Junna-in Temple was created in 881 and Shogaku-in Temple was founded in the same year, it is presumed that either Minamoto no Toru, who was then the highest-ranking courtier among the people of Saga-Genji as well as the whole of Minamoto clan, or his son Minamoto no Noboru was the first person who concurrently assumed the position of the chief priest of both temples and Genji choja.

However, judging from the fact that the post of Junnain betto was created in 881 and Shogakuin itself was founded in the same year, it is presumed that either MINAMOTO no Toru, who was then the highest-ranking court noble among the people of Saga-Genji as well as the whole of Minamoto clan, or his son MINAMOTO no Noboru was the first person who concurrently assumed the betto of both schools and Genji choja.

sen.e: Provided, however, that as Shogaku-in Temple was the facility for all of kobetsu-shizoku (families branched out from the Imperial family), there is a possibility that its chief priest was not Genji choja but the choja of all of such families including Taira clan and Ebara clan.

sen.e: Genji choja was merely the highest title among Minamoto clans after the cpllapse of the Ritsuryo system.

Genji choja was merely the highest title among Minamoto clans after the collapse of the Ritsuryo system.
sen.cmt: cpllapse を collapse に修正しました。

sen.j: 一方、徳川家康はその権威に着目し、藤原姓を源姓に改め征夷大将軍と源氏長者を一身に兼ねることにより日本国王に相当する権威を手に入れて公家と武家の掌握に利用した、という足利義満＝日本国王論に依拠した説がある（岡野友彦）。
sen.e: On the other hand, there is a theory, which is based on the theory of Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA=King of Japan, that Ieyasu TOKUGAWA saw the advantage of its authority, changed himself from Fujiwara cognomen to Minamoto cognomen, obtained the power equivalent to that of the King of Japan by becoming both seii taishogun (literally, great general who subdues th barbarians) and Genji choja and used such power for controling both court nobles and samurai families (Tomohiko OKANO).

sen.j: しかし、通説とはなっていない。
sen.e: However, the above theory is not being accepted commonly.
